value.expression:
("<s>[INST] <<SYS>>
You are a helpful, respectful and honest assistant. Always answer as helpfully as possible, while being safe. Be brief in your answers. Your answers should not include any harmful, unethical, racist, sexist, toxic, dangerous, or illegal content. Please ensure that your responses are socially unbiased and positive in nature.

If a question does not make any sense, or is not factually coherent, explain why instead of answering something not correct. If you don’t know the answer to a question, please don’t share false information.
<</SYS>>

Generate the next agent response by answering the question. You are provided several documents with titles. If the answer comes from different documents please mention all possibilities and use the titles of documents to separate between topics or domains. If you cannot base your answer on the given documents, please state that you do not have an answer.

").concat(${passages}).concat("

[question]: ").concat(${query_text}).concat("[/INST]")

concat.scalar:
***WARNING***
**discovery_project_id** is not defined, which will cause queries to **Watson Discovery** to fail.
To find your Watson Discovery project_id, please open [your Watson Discovery instance](https://cloud.ibm.com/resources), open your Watson Discovery project, navigate to 'Integrate and deploy', then click 'API Information', then copy the Project ID.
Then,

set the initial value of discovery_project_id to this copied Project ID by opening your Assistant instance, navigating to the Actions page, clicking 'Created by me' under 'Variables', clicking discovery_project_id, pasting the Project ID as the Initial value, and clicking Save.
-- Need more help? Contact your IBM representative, [book a call](https://www.ibm.
com/account/reg/signup?formid=MAIL-watson), or [email our team](https://www.ibm.com/account/reg/us-en/signup?formid=MAIL-watsonassistant) for support.

***WARNING***
**watsonx_project_id** is not defined, which will cause calls to **watsonx** to fail.
To find your watsonx project_id, please open [your watsonx instance](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/wx/home?context=wx), click your watsonx project, navigate to 'Manage', then click 'General', then copy the Project ID.
Then,

set the initial value of watsonx_project_id to this copied Project ID by opening your Assistant instance, navigating to the Actions page, clicking 'Created by me' under 'Variables', clicking watsonx_project_id, pasting the Project ID as the Initial value, and clicking Save.
-- Need more help? Contact your IBM representative, [book a call](https://www.ibm.
com/account/reg/signup?formid=MAIL-watson), or [email our team](https://www.ibm.com/account/reg/us-en/signup?formid=MAIL-watsonassistant) for support.
Sorry, the search failed!

variables.title: discovery_date_version
variables.description: Discovery date versions are documented in the release notes (https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-release-notes).

variables.title: discovery_project_id
variables.description: You MUST set this value to the project ID of the Discovery project containing your data

variables.title: model_id
variables.description: The ID of the model to be used for this user prompt.

variables.title: model_parameters_max_new_tokens
variables.description: The maximum number of new tokens to be generated.

variables.title: model_parameters_min_new_tokens
variables.description: The minimum number of new tokens to be generated.

variables.title: model_parameters_temperature
variables.description: he value used to control the next token probabilities. The range is from 0.05 to 1.00; 0.05 makes it mostly deterministic.

variables.title: model_response
variables.description: The text generated by the model in response to the model input

variables.title: query_text
variables.description: You MAY change this to pass queries to Watson Discovery. By default the Search action passes the user’s input.text directly.

variables.title: watsonx_api_version
variables.description: The version of the watsonx api (required)

variables.title: watsonx_project_id
variables.description: You MUST set this to your watsonx project id
